intro: Wilkesia gymnoxiphium, commonly known as the Koa tree, is a rare and endemic species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats at high elevations on the island of Hawaii. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment and is considered a keystone species in certain forest ecosystems. Due to habitat loss and introduced pests, it is also classified as endangered.
